articles.title: “Football is toxic. Juve, Naples and Argentina, I’ll tell you everything”
articles.description: MIAMI (USA) - The Argentinian striker Gonzalo Higuain returns to speak after the announcement of his retirement. The footballer gave a long interview in which he talks about his experiences in the world of football. "I started playing for love of the game - he says exclusively to Goal - I was driven by passion.

articles.title: Five reasons why Lionel Messi is football's GOAT
articles.description: Lionel Messi's name is synonymous with football. Right from the moment the 17-year-old wunderkind made his senior debut for FC Barcelona back in 2004, the left-footed magician from Argentina has racked up several accolades as well as broken numerous records, which may be hard for future generations to breach. Here are 5 reasons why Leo is considered the GOAT (greatest of all

articles.title: Gimnasia fan dies in Boca Juniors crowd clashes in Argentina
articles.description: During the game between Gimnasia and Boca Juniors in the city of La Plata, there were fights between the crowd and the police
articles.content:
During the game between Gimnasia and Boca Juniors, there were fights between fans and police.
Tear gas and rubber bullets were used to stop the fights.
One person died and many more were hurt during the games in La Plata, Argentina.

articles.title: Football fan dies after Argentinian police use teargas at Gimnasia v Boca
articles.description: A football fan died in Argentina and the match between Gimnasia La Plata and Boca Juniors was abandoned after teargas fired by police outside the venue drifted into the stadium
articles.content:
A football fan died in Argentina and the match between Gimnasia La Plata and Boca Juniors was abandoned on Thursday after teargas fired by police outside the venue drifted into the stadium and made it difficult for players and spectators to breathe.

articles.title: Sticker Shock: How Messi and the Market Fed a Collectible Crisis
articles.description: In Argentina, white-hot demand for a beloved World Cup collectible has produced long lines, surging prices and, briefly, government intervention.
